metadata.title: CVE-2016-3705 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The (1) xmlParserEntityCheck and (2) xmlParseAttValueComplex functions inparser.c in libxml2 2.9.3 do not properly keep track of the recursiondepth, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (stack consumption and application crash) via a crafted XMLdocument containing a large number of nested entity references.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
libxml2-utils - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
python-libxml2 - 2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.3+dfsg1-1ubuntu0.1').
